trans-unit.source: Provides a string that describes an individual configuration property.

The <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsDescriptionAttribute> is intended to assist both design time tools and administrative run time tools in identifying and describing the associated configuration property.
This attribute is optional and can only be applied at the individual configuration property level.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingsDescriptionAttribute"></xref> class.

Although the description has a theoretical maximum length of the <xref:System.String> class, whose length is represented by a <xref:System.Int32>, the following two practical considerations will limit the size of the `description` parameter:
Large text descriptions are difficult to display in a user interface (UI) and difficult for the user to read.
Settings providers may enforce overall usage quotas and are required to enforce user configuration quotas.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> used as descriptive text.
Gets the descriptive text for the associated configuration property.
The <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsDescriptionAttribute.Description%2A> property is set by the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsDescriptionAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the descriptive text for the associated configuration property.
